Based on your preference cues, I would recommend "The Sorcerer's Apprentice" (2010). The movie follows the story of a young boy who discovers that he has the ability to control fire. He is fascinated by this power and spends hours experimenting with it. However, one day, while playing with his friends, he accidentally triggers a fire in his house. Devastated by this accident, the boy decides to give up on his powers completely. However, after spending some time away from his powers, the boy eventually realizes that his powers are actually quite useful in certain situations. And so, with newfound appreciation for his powers, the boy decides to continue exploring and using his powers in various ways throughout his life.
Based on your preference cues, I would recommend "Saving Private Ryan" (1998). The movie follows the story of a group of U.S. soldiers who are sent behind enemy lines to retrieve a paratrooper whose brothers have been killed in action. The movie is a powerful portrayal of the brutal realities of war and the profound impact that such experiences can have on individuals and communities.
Based on your preference cues, I would recommend "Dear John" (2010). The movie follows the story of a man who is hired by a wealthy businessman to be his private secretary. However, as the man becomes more involved in the businessman's affairs, he begins to realize that there are much darker and sinister forces at work behind the scenes of this businessman's affairs. And so, with newfound appreciation for the true nature of this businessman's affairs, the man decides to continue exploring and using his insights into these affairs in various ways throughout his life.

Based on the user's preference cues, I recommend Trust (2010)) as a suitable recommendation.
Trust (2010)) is a psychological thriller that follows the story of a young couple who are trying to get pregnant. However, when they finally have a baby, they realize that their little one is not biologically theirs but the result of a tragic event in their past life.
As the story unfolds, the audience becomes more and more involved in the events happening on screen. The audience is taken on a journey through time and space as the characters are forced to confront some very difficult and painful challenges in their lives.
Trust (2010)) is an excellent example of how a psychological thriller can be made even more compelling by including elements of suspense, mystery, and intrigue.
Overall, Trust (2010)) is a well-made psychological thriller that effectively captures the essence of trust, its importance in relationships, and the challenges people face when trying to build and maintain trust in their lives.
